\subsection{Main Module}
\label{\detokenize{main:main-module}}\label{\detokenize{main::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module initializes and starts the game.
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!main@\spxentry{main}}\index{main@\spxentry{main}!module@\spxentry{module}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{main:module-main}}

\subsection{Core Module}
\label{\detokenize{core:core-module}}\label{\detokenize{core::doc}}

\subsubsection{game\_of\_life module}
\label{\detokenize{core:module-core.game_of_life}}\label{\detokenize{core:game-of-life-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!core.game\_of\_life@\spxentry{core.game\_of\_life}}\index{core.game\_of\_life@\spxentry{core.game\_of\_life}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module defines the core logic for customizable version of Conway’s Game of Life.
It provides grid state management and rules for updating generations.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Author: Shehabeldin Mohamed
Version: 1.0
\index{GameOfLife (class in core.game\_of\_life)@\spxentry{GameOfLife}\spxextra{class in core.game\_of\_life}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{core:core.game_of_life.GameOfLife}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{k}{class}\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.game\_of\_life.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{GameOfLife}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{width}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{int}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{height}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{int}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{wrap}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Supports wraparound edges and configurable rules as follows:
A live cell survives if alive neighbors are within under/overpopulation limits.
A dead cell becomes alive if it has exactly \sphinxtitleref{custom\_reproduction\_number} neighbors.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{width}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Width of the grid in cells.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{height}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Height of the grid in cells.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{wrap}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} Whether the grid wraps around the edges.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\pysigstopsignatures

Reset the grid to all dead cells and reset generation count.

\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar

Set custom rules for cell survival and reproduction.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{overpop}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Maximum neighbors before a cell dies from overpopulation.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{underpop}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Minimum neighbors for a live cell to survive.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{repro}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Exact number of neighbors required for a dead cell to reproduce.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsubsection{infinite\_game module}
\label{\detokenize{core:module-core.infinite_game}}\label{\detokenize{core:infinite-game-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!core.infinite\_game@\spxentry{core.infinite\_game}}\index{core.infinite\_game@\spxentry{core.infinite\_game}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{InfiniteGameOfLife (class in core.infinite\_game)@\spxentry{InfiniteGameOfLife}\spxextra{class in core.infinite\_game}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{core:core.infinite_game.InfiniteGameOfLife}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{k}{class}\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.infinite\_game.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{InfiniteGameOfLife}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Implementation of Conway’s Game of Life with infinite grid.
Uses dictionary to store only live cells, allowing for infinite expansion.
Coordinates can be any integer (positive or negative).

\sphinxAtStartPar
Author: Darya Sharnevich
Version: 1.0
\index{\_count\_neighbors() (core.infinite\_game.InfiniteGameOfLife method)@\spxentry{\_count\_neighbors()}\spxextra{core.infinite\_game.InfiniteGameOfLife method}}

\subsection{GUI Module}
\label{\detokenize{gui:gui-module}}\label{\detokenize{gui::doc}}

\subsubsection{Main GUI Modules}
\label{\detokenize{gui:main-gui-modules}}

\subsubsection{game\_gui module}
\label{\detokenize{gui:game-gui-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!gui.game\_gui@\spxentry{gui.game\_gui}}\index{gui.game\_gui@\spxentry{gui.game\_gui}!module@\spxentry{module}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{gui:module-gui.game_gui}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Game of Life GUI using PyQt5

\sphinxAtStartPar
A zoomable, pannable, interactive GUI for Conway’s Game of Life.
Integrates both fixed and infinite grid implementations.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Author: Darya Sharnevich
Version: 1.1
\index{GameOfLifeGUI (class in gui.game\_gui)@\spxentry{GameOfLifeGUI}\spxextra{class in gui.game\_gui}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{gui:gui.game_gui.GameOfLifeGUI}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{k}{class}\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{gui.game\_gui.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{GameOfLifeGUI}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{menu\_window}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{speed}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{10}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{fixed\_view}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{width}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{height}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{wrap}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}

GUI for the Game of Life.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{speed}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Initial simulation speed (generations / second).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fixed\_view}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} If True, grid has fixed width and height, panning/zoom is disabled.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{width}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Width of the grid in cells (required for fixed grid mode).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Main menu window for the Game of Life application.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Provides options to start the game\_window, open settings, view game\_window info, or exit.
Also handles game\_window configuration including grid size, wrapping, speed, and custom rules.

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{gui:gui.game_modules.grid_canvas.GridCanvas}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{k}{class}\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{gui.game\_modules.grid\_canvas.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{GridCanvas}}}

{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{QWidget}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Interactive canvas for displaying and manipulating the Game of Life grid.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Supports:
\sphinxhyphen{} Cell toggling with left mouse button
\sphinxhyphen{} Grid panning with right mouse button
\sphinxhyphen{} Zoom with mouse wheel
\sphinxhyphen{} Fixed and infinite grid modes
\sphinxhyphen{} Custom color schemes
\index{\_draw\_line\_between\_points() (gui.game\_modules.grid\_canvas.GridCanvas method)@\spxentry{\_draw\_line\_between\_points()}\spxextra{gui.game\_modules.grid\_canvas.GridCanvas method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures

{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Draw a continuous line of live cells between two points using Bresenham’s algorithm.

\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}
